website_summaries.verdict: The perfect halfway point between milk and solid foods, this nutritious and delicious milk supplement will get eager kittens eating kibble and canned food before you know it.
pros: Made with real milk and beef
Contains high levels of vitamins and minerals
cons: This supplement requires you to prepare it for your growing kitten, but it’s a straightforward process

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I had 6 foster kittens that came to me at 3 weeks - some were really reluctant bottle feeders - but they loved this stuff! They quickly weaned off the bottles and sucked this stuff down - since you mix it with water, you can control the consistency. I took them from milky to solid kitten food, and mixed it in to the kitten food - and they loved it and are all thriving in their adopted homes. I called it "Kitten crack" as a joke - don't want to be offensive or make light of drug use - but they were all into this stuff, really.
customer_reviews.author: DCMARS

customer_reviews.title: Caused diareah
customer_reviews.text: Tried this on a litter of 4 kittens age 4-5 weeks old. They did like the taste and ate it right up, but then had diareah. Tried it 3 times and each time within 10 mins they had diareah. Tried them on moistened dry kitten food and no diareah but slow eating. I would not recommend continued use of this product if your kittens have the same issue as they can get dehydrated. Adding to my review....I tried it mixed with water and they had no diareah. Tried again with KMR mixed in and within minutes diareah.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. I always have. I rescue cats. Please spay and neuter.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Mom

customer_reviews.title: This is a large amount and I'll be donating the remainder to the local animal shelter as she is three months and doing great. Wi
customer_reviews.text: For rescue kitten nourishment this was key to getting her healthy. I used it before I could worm her (have to be 8 wks) when she was thrown up and having diarrhea. She lapped it up - I made up just a small dish at a time with hot spring water working the lumps out with the back of a spoon. She was already eating solid canned kitten food but I gave her both and this dish was always empty. This is a large amount and I'll be donating the remainder to the local animal shelter as she is three months and doing great. Will vacuum seal a small amount for any health emergencies in the future.
customer_reviews.author: beachspirit

customer_reviews.title: 😺😺😺ALL YOU NEED😻😻😻FOR STRONG KITTENS😺😺😺& MAMA CAT RECOVERY
customer_reviews.text: My kittens did not like this in the beginning.... because I was feeding them Mackerel fish , with part 1st Step formula mashed up... SO when I offered it was too "beefy" for Baby taste buds... After a few days they accepted it's taste...Milky Beef...was not expecting that,lol. Reading is fundamental! I tasted the milk myself...it smells strong like beef without seasoning... But it still TASTED LIKE BABY FORMULA!!!! My kittens get gas after feeding... Smells strong . Their stool has gotten a little firmer since last week..And Stronger Aroma lol...Its chalked full of NOW & NEXT STAGE NUTRIENTS. I REPLENISH THEIR MOMS BALANCE AS WELL...GREAT BUY FOR THE MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: Mz.Bozz

customer_reviews.title: Lumpy beef gravy flavored formula causes diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loved this beef gravy flavored goop. I did not like it one bit. It was easy to mix with 2 part water to 1 part mix. It doesn't mix that well. Shaking in a bottle helped get the lumps out after I had mixed it in a measuring cup. It is lumpy and if it sits for any period of time it gets a film on top. It caused my kitty to have diarrhea every single time she ate this. I finally had to stop giving it to her because it was just not worth the pain of a potty training kitten having diarrhea.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Abels

customer_reviews.title: High Calorie & Easy Weaning!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for weaning kittens without too much tummy upset and keeping the caloric value high for these lite guys. Rescue kittens depend on Kmr, and I was not wanting to blow through regular Kmr making the slurry weaning formula and this was perfect for adding to a high quality kitten food. Happy kittens all around.
customer_reviews.author: Missy K.

customer_reviews.title: Good for precocious weaners
customer_reviews.text: I bottle-foster orphaned kittens, and have found this to be useful on several occasions. When I get the babies young and they bottle-feed regularly, I prefer to wean with the canned food/formula slurry. However, you occasionally get one a little older, 3-4 weeks, who reject bottles and will readily go for canned food, but their little digestive tracts aren't quite mature enough to be completely weaned from formula. This product is a great way to give them the "meat" that entices them to eat, but to also supply plenty of "milk" type nutrition without thinning down their food too much.
customer_reviews.author: Ruebette

customer_reviews.title: A must have for mama cats and kittens!
customer_reviews.text: I use this both for weaning kittens and a boost in nutrition for mama to be and nursing cats. Easy to use. I've found shaking it together with the water in a shaker/small container with a lid works a TON better and is MUCH faster than stirring it together. Every cat and kitten I've given it to can't get enough of it!
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: cats love it
customer_reviews.text: I got this to get more nutrients and hydration into a skinny elder cat. All of my cats demanded some and love the taste a lot more than kmr that is sometimes given to sick cats. The ratio doesn't have to be as perfect as with kmr to get cats to eat, I can just sprinkle some on water and they go nuts, so very good for cats that need more hydration. They'll lap up the whole dish. It isn't complete in its nutrition so if giving to a sick cat over time they still need wet food / vitamins.
customer_reviews.author: cm

customer_reviews.title: Causes diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for baby raccoons that I rescued, I was using the "KMR - Kitten Milk Replacer" and thought I could transition them over to this before solid foods, well it caused severe diarrhea, and I did not even get thru the first can, I mixed it 1 scoop to 3 parts water, and had to pull them off and go back to KMR - Kitten Milk Replacer. If you are rescuing wildlife, I DO NOT RECOOMEND THIS PRODUCT! Stick with the KMR - Kitten Milk Replacer.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Great as liquid input if you cat doesn’t like water.
customer_reviews.text: My kitten loves this “milk”. She is 14 weeks but I still give her a bowl of this every butane she loves it. I prepared her 2 spoon with warm water every night. Is her favorite time of the day!!! She doesn’t like water at all so I use this as her daily liquid input. She eats Fancy Feast wet food during the day. She is a very happy and healthy cat! Now follow me on Instagram for more reviews @lolavur Comment #IamAmazon to let me know your coming from here 😁
customer_reviews.author: Carlota Veras

customer_reviews.title: Throwing this away – made my cat sick
customer_reviews.text: This made my cat vomit almost immediately after eating it. I tried it again a few days later, thinking maybe it was the canned cat food I had mixed it with that made her sick, but she vomited again soon afterwards. She does not have a sensitive stomach and this is the first time she’s ever thrown up. Needless to say, this is going in the garbage!
customer_reviews.author: katyroadpink

customer_reviews.title: Great product make sure you mix it well.  Warm water works best
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use make sure you stir it and mix it very very well because it does clump easily kind of like flour. Don't mix more than what you're going to need at the time. goes bad after about an hour after sitting out so make sure you throw it out and don't let your babies eat or drink it after an hour or so. As I got to where I was weaning my little rescue guy, I would mix this up with hot water and put some of his dry food in with it to soften it and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: They will eat it, eventually.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 wk old kittens. They weren't eating very much so I wanted to supplement their diet. I just mix it in a shallow dish with warm water and they seem to like it. I had to put some on my finger first.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Great second step for fosters
customer_reviews.text: I love using this second step when the kittens Im fostering are ready to get weaned and switched to dry food. I prepare it as stated, it dissolves and mixes well, and then I will mix it in the dry food to mush it up a bit. Sometimes I think the kittens like the mix better than the milk alone. I love that it continues to give the kittens the nutrients they need as they are being weaned and I couldn't imagine not having it in my home.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiFar83

customer_reviews.title: caused wet stools
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as weaning food, from the PetAg kitten milk, which kittens love. But seems to cause wet stools if not diarrhea, more than milk. I stopped using it after a few days, still have lots left in the can. A little trouble to mix everytime too. I would recommend just skipping this product, go straight from milk substitute like PetAg to Kitten chow that is lightly moistened/softened with milk.
customer_reviews.author: Cost Performance Assessor

customer_reviews.title: Not for sensitive kitty
customer_reviews.text: You really don't know if kitty is sensitive to this change in diet or not until you try this product. And as it turned out, two of my 3 kittens were and developed runny stool and now have red, raw bottoms. To avoid, introduce 2nd phase with phase 1 milk powder. In other words, mix together and gradually, introduce this product to your kittens.
customer_reviews.author: FK2611

customer_reviews.title: Thankful for this supplement
customer_reviews.text: Our kitten was weaned at just over 4 weeks and was not doing well as he was so young. After starting him on this formula mixed with his wet food he is doing much better and has more energy and is more active. He was super skinny before and appears to be gaining more weight now. He just wasn't quite ready to be weaned and I am thankful for this product to help him grow and put on weight. I no longer fear fading kitten illness!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent formula!
customer_reviews.text: My kitten absolutely lived on this formula the first several weeks of her life. She was abandoned by her mom at less than a week old, so I fed her every 2 hours day and night via bottle. This formula helped her grow strong and healthy. She is now 17 weeks old and is thriving and playful. This was her lifeline when she couldn't eat solid foods. It is easy to prepare, mix, keep and feed.
customer_reviews.author: CMG

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this for some animals I'm doing rescue and Rehabilitation 2 release nobody wants to eat this I tried giving it to my raccoon same thing I know my cat's wouldn't want to use it either it's such a shame a good name brand product but you're really not sure what to do with it it's just sick liquid kind of a waste of your time to transition from solids
customer_reviews.author: Meadow Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this product and so do my kitties. They’re over 8 weeks now but still love it so much so they share a bowl every night. The bowl is literally licked clean, they climb my legs while I’m making it just to watch on the counter LOL. They’ve not had any upset stomachs or bad poop from it either. I’ll probably keep giving it to them even as they get older just because they love it so much. They are 11 weeks now. And for the price it’s a great supplemental treat.
customer_reviews.author: Allie Huckle

customer_reviews.title: Foster Kittens LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: The is amazing for when my foster kittens are done being bottle bed or weaned from their (usually feral) mama's and can start eating KMR 2nd step mixed with some wet food. Makes them catch on to "lapping" quicker and fills them up easier.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Different batches
customer_reviews.text: Bought one from Amazon for $10 and saw on Chewy.com for $5. Bought 8 additional on Chewy. Opened Chewy can - smells like it was burned, At ration higher than 3:1 (first step to second step formula) kittens had diareah. Amazon can is better, but still has light burned smell.
customer_reviews.author: Marina Pushkareva

customer_reviews.title: My Kittens, are growing big and beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked very well, when weaning my two little newborn, abandoned Kittens off of the KMR Milk Replacer. In three days they were eating canned, Kitty wet food! They are growing like weeds, only difference is they are growing big and beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon13

customer_reviews.title: Really didn’t know what this does
customer_reviews.text: I really don’t think I needed to give my kittens this step. Just moved them to a slurry (soft kitten food mixed with their formula) now their favorite food is dry kitten, soft kitten or anything they think they can steal from my dinner plate! Monsters🐾❤️
customer_reviews.author: Laura L.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it bad stuff
customer_reviews.text: Do not get this it made my kittens have extremely runny poop and I followed the instructions perfectly I don’t know what’s in it that is making the kittens digestive system work wonky but stick to the regular formula and just lean them off that
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mama cat enjoyed 2nd step
customer_reviews.text: Had never used this product before but when my Persian cat had kittens we used KMR to supplement her milk, feeding with a nursing bottle. At 4 weeks I began KMR 2nd step, serving it on a plate after mixing with water. The kittens lapped it up quickly. I fed 2nd step 4 times per day until the kittens were eating regular food. Mama cat enjoyed 2nd step, as well, and I always had to make her an extra serving. Second Step provided a delicious meal full of nutrition. Weaning was a simple and pleasant process. I would use this product again with complete confidence.
customer_reviews.author: mrs. jones

customer_reviews.title: Kittens loved it..for a short while.
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the idea of having to mix this along with KMR, but even by itself my kittens loved it, but they only wanted it for about a week and then they wouldn't touch it! It helped immensely to wean my kittens and training to eat/drink from a bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Orcus

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: I used it initially for a kitten who rejected its mother, on top of several chronic health issues it had. My kitten thrived on this stuff - when I couldn't afford it, her growth became stunted (she was literally half the size of her siblings). Four years later, she still gets a daily serving of KMR for the added nutrients, on top of her regular diet. She is much more lively when she has this stuff, and her coat is softer than any cat I've ever known.
customer_reviews.author: Kamikan

customer_reviews.title: This is the best milk replacement available.
customer_reviews.text: Raising a kitten abandoned at birth has been a difficult task. The KMR is the stuff that has been able to keep it healthy. Originally, using another milk supplement, the kitten had terrible diarrhea and digestive problems. Once we switched over to KMR, the kitten has been much healthier. I will not use any other milk replacement other than KMR.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: Other animals may like it. I couldn’t get any of my cats or dog to eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Meanie

customer_reviews.title: Good second step but causes digestive problems
customer_reviews.text: I started using this when my kitten needed to be weaned from the milk replacement. Within a few days, she developed watery bowel movements. I then started to mix it with the milk replacement and the loose bowels started to dissipate. Other reviews complain of diarrhea so be prepared to mix this with something else and don’t use it as the only food source.
customer_reviews.author: T. Troy

customer_reviews.title: It is not a good product for all baby cats.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2 kittens . I given this 2 step replace milk but..... both have started only diarrhea..few days.... and I have changed feeding after stopped it. I think it is no good all kitten...exceptly..
customer_reviews.author: eunjin

customer_reviews.title: Kittens love it
customer_reviews.text: started using with 5 week old kittens.. they loved it. I then used it to soften kitten kibble and then mixed with their canned food. They prefer it. At 7 weeks, one kitten was not liking food kibble or wet. He was falling behind in his weight. I mixed some of this up and sure enough he ate almost 1/4 cup in one sitting. Litter box was not pleasant but it wasn't pleasant with formula either. These guys seemed extra smelly and runny until about week 7 when they were on 75% kibble.
customer_reviews.author: CPark

customer_reviews.title: One of my foster kittens was really feeling the need ...
customer_reviews.text: One of my foster kittens was really feeling the need for milk although he was already weaned when I got him. This was bought to help him and the others put on weight and it really worked. However, I may have created a monster because if he doesn't have a bowl of milk he'll try to get into the canister! Haha! =^_^=
customer_reviews.author: Alysha Terry

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my second step for my kittens. Now I mix it dry with my dry kitten food. It works well for me in a automatic feeder. I just coat the food with it. My kittens are very healthy and their coats are shiny. I might quit using it when they turn a year old.
customer_reviews.author: DLW

customer_reviews.title: Arrives fast & great price!
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be hard to switch from the cans of pre-mixed, and now I needed a formula to wean from, and it’s working great so far. Excellent price and fast shipping. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Stinky Diarrhea at a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Served its purpose as a transition food but gave my kitten smelly diarrhea. That is to say my kitten drank the mixture with enthusiasm and it kept her alive and nourished like food should but at the expense of producing such foul-smelling diarrhea that my eyebrows may have been singed off in the process of cleaning the litter box. However, diarrhea may be unavoidable no matter the product for all I know. The price was pretty good considering how many meals one can prepare with a small can.
customer_reviews.author: Adrien Hopkinson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kittens
customer_reviews.text: How can you raise orphan kittens without this? Easy to use, we switched to it after going through a can of KMR with our stray kitten. He absolutely adores it, and is as healthy and sleek as he could possibly be. When we started with this product, we were feeding him 2 tablespoons 5 times a day. On our second can, he has it for breakfast (1 tablespoon) with some Royal Canin Kitten Instinctive mixed in.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tait

customer_reviews.title: Kitten fuel
customer_reviews.text: We found a sick 2 week old kitten who's mother died under our house we took him in and raised him on this stuff, feeding it through a syringe until he got a little bigger. We gradually transitioned him to solid wet food then dry kitten food then adult food. One year later a happy healthy cat.
customer_reviews.author: Markscreename

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: We found abandoned kittens, this was a couple dollars cheaper that my local store had, they seem to be thriving and healthy! This may have saved them
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Yuck
customer_reviews.text: The premixed milk supplement was Excepted well by my babies but the winning product was lumpy and nasty. They wouldn’t touch it. Very overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for sick kittens
customer_reviews.text: Had a very sick 12-week-old who needed to be syringe-fed for weeks and wouldn't eat on her own. We started with this in the syringe and later mixed it with wet food and water for extra calories.
customer_reviews.author: Sola

customer_reviews.title: The only thing my kitten will eat
customer_reviews.text: The only thing my kitten will eat. He is 9 weeks old and refuses solids. Once the vets open again for non emergencies I'll have him checked. Until then, this is great for him.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Excellent food for tiny kittens.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great value on kitten food. I’ve ordered again. I had no problems at all with diarrhea as others have, and the kittens loved the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was shipped promptly and recommended by the shelter for a pregnant/lactating queen and her ...
customer_reviews.text: This was shipped promptly and recommended by the shelter for a pregnant/lactating queen and her kittens. I cannot attest to the taste, but they all went for the formula before they ate their canned food so the kittens are giving a 5 star review!
customer_reviews.author: pryncessr

customer_reviews.title: Kittens seemed to like it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for the kittens I had to bottle feed. Price was better than I expected and cheaper than in the store. Kittens seem to like it while I was giving them wet food
customer_reviews.author: Angela Farooqui

customer_reviews.title: and this gave them the worst smelling diarrhea and gas
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 bottle babies I am fostering, and this gave them the worst smelling diarrhea and gas. I think mixing KMR with wet kitten food to make a slurry is much better since they will be transitioning to just wet kitten food without KMR soon.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela V.

customer_reviews.title: Upset our Kittens’ stomachs
customer_reviews.text: Gave our Persian kittens diarrhea, we immediately discontinued giving this and went back to KMR 1st step which they had been eating before. Decided to mix the KMR 1st step with little bits of canned food instead and they responded better.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa on Whidbey

customer_reviews.title: NEED TO ADD PUMPKIN IN THE MIXTURE
customer_reviews.text: I had to add pumpkin so my kittens won’t have diarrhea! Now they’re loving it and can’t wait for their next meal!
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Weird Product
customer_reviews.text: The kittens did not like this and I was unsure of how to use it. It came with instructions but the kittens were not interested. Not great for weaning
customer_reviews.author: mark nash-ford

customer_reviews.title: no digestive problems and they liked it. Would use again
customer_reviews.text: Used this product to wean three kittens from KMR to food. I was mixing KMR with Turkey and giblets pate and slowly replaced the KMR with KMR step 2 to soften and moisten the food. Worked well, no digestive problems and they liked it. Would use again.
customer_reviews.author: WtPoint

customer_reviews.title: Great milk
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know 2nd step existed and the 3 kittens I got didnt have the best milk and nutrition when they were born so they were on the kmr longer then needed and now they're on this. They drink it up pretty quickly and I try to give wet meats more, but I can see where the milk is helping the runt grow and her cost get more shiny and full.
customer_reviews.author: Cristie

customer_reviews.title: My kitten loved this milk
customer_reviews.text: My kitten loved this milk she didn’t want to stop drinking it even after her 8 weeks but I disposed of it. It’s literally like making milk for a baby 🤷🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Madelyn

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not as good as original
customer_reviews.text: Would very much prefer that this didn't have beef flavor. Most kitten food is chicken or seafood
customer_reviews.author: M Trimbell

customer_reviews.title: Works well to put weight on kittens or sick cats.
customer_reviews.text: Had a litter of kittens my momma cat was really a small cat. She had 5 kittens so some were a bit sickly it really helped them put on weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda 1030

customer_reviews.title: Caused Major Diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: My foster kittens loved this formula. Unfortunately, it gave them horrible diarrhea. I could feel/hear their little bellies rumbling every time I picked them up. I don’t think it’s worth the risk of trying and upsetting their bellies so much.
customer_reviews.author: D.C.

customer_reviews.title: Good transition food for weaning kittens.
customer_reviews.text: Mixed into wet food with a little water it makes a great transition food from bottle/gruel to wet food. Kittens fat and healthy and happy.
customer_reviews.author: Diane in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect food
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect weaning food. It mixes to a runny cereal and you can add ground cat food to it a little at at a time as the kittens grow. Unlike the KMR (first step) it does not need refrigeration. I've weaned two litters on it so far and judging by their purrs, they were all very satisfied customers.
customer_reviews.author: Editpro45

customer_reviews.title: Kitty milk
customer_reviews.text: Really I have no clue to taste, but kittens seem to love it. Easy to mix
customer_reviews.author: Cat T

customer_reviews.title: Our Cat Really Likes this Formula
customer_reviews.text: Our cat won't stop asking for this milk, even though she is now three months old!
customer_reviews.author: M. Landolina

customer_reviews.title: A kitten lifesaver!!!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Brought our stray kitten back to life and added weight quickly to the little fella. He loved his "milk" and had no trouble digesting it other than diarrhea, which we expected.
customer_reviews.author: VirtualVE

customer_reviews.title: They Love It
customer_reviews.text: I used this for kittens that were about 2-3 weeks old when they were found. They ate it right away and all went well. Later I ground dry kitten food and added this Stage 2 to the ground food and warm water.
customer_reviews.author: Ry

customer_reviews.title: Great for the weaning process.
customer_reviews.text: I use KMR formula in syringes for abandoned baby kittens (always keep their heads up and never let them breath in or they will die). When they are ready for more, I mix KMR formula with rice cereal and feed it to them in syringes until they can lick it up in a bowl. When they are done with the syringes, I mix KMR formula with the 2nd step and rice cereal to a thicker consistency until they start to move onto wet food. It is a must if you are caring for weaning kittens.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Great product good price and kittens love it
customer_reviews.text: As I wrote before this is a very good product for kittens I would tell everyone to buy it
customer_reviews.author: Karen Yacovelli

customer_reviews.title: ok i guess
customer_reviews.text: I assume they got it. never heard fro the charity that it was delivered
customer_reviews.author: rick white

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My kittens love this and are growing. They are very healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Mary W.

customer_reviews.title: Mix with warm water. Kitten will love it
customer_reviews.text: My rescue kitten now about 7 weeks old likes this mixed with warm water. He laps it up along with some soft canned food and looks for more. He is thriving.
customer_reviews.author: LyNn

customer_reviews.title: Great for continued supplement of an older but very small ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for continued supplement of an older but very small kitten. I was able to keep her on this long after Momma was done weaning.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle J

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, I'm not going to taste it to rate the flavor. :-) But, I will say that we have had a number of failure to thrive kittens, abandoned by their mamas, over the years, and only once have I had a kitten who wouldn't take to KMR. Currently, we use KMR or Second Step to supplement canned food for an 8-year-old cat who refuses to be weaned. He seems to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Bell

customer_reviews.title: 2 paw up!
customer_reviews.text: I had a 4 week old kitten that was difficult to wean. He had been abandoned by his mother and refused to drink anything except milk from a bottle. We started him on a mix of this and KMR (kitten formula) and eventually got him to lap it out of a bowl. We mixed wet food with this after a week or two and he was finally weaned off the bottle. This product was amazing! I use it on all my rescue kittens that need to be weaned and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Darian V.

customer_reviews.title: My kitten loved it!
customer_reviews.text: My kitten loved it!! He got used to it quickly and never had stomach problems
customer_reviews.author: Clara Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Introduced food gradually
customer_reviews.text: This is my second can of the 2 nd step. I mix it with the kmr formula and kitties love it. Like the can says, gradually introduce this food into the kitties diet as you would do with any new cat food. None of the kitties have gi upset. I give this 2nd food an A+.
customer_reviews.author: Sheba

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Kittens wouldnt eat it. They had no interest, even adult cats didnt care for it or even the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: From all I've read, I believe this is truly a great product.
customer_reviews.text: I read an article that recommended 2nd Step Kitten Food to supplement the diets of elderly cats, who don't take in the calories they need. I bought it to give my sweet, elderly cat, but unfortunately, I couldn't get her to eat it. From all I've read, I believe this is truly a great product. It just didn't work out for my kitty.
customer_reviews.author: Valleri

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: The kittens love this stuff! I rescued 2 batches of feral kittens and all of them love it. I mixed it with the KMR milk at first then as they got older I used water. I also mixed in some kitten Fancy Feast to get them used to soft food. The mother cat likes it too and gets extra nutrition from it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynderbell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product we raised orphan kitten on the formula he has grown into healthy young cat
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: depends on your kitten
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this stuff has worked on other kittens, but my 5 week old refused to eat it. The only way to get him to eat it was to put it in the bottle with his formula and I stopped doing that because he started to have really bad farts and had some diarrhea. Now he is back to just plain kmr and I will go get some canned food to see if he will eat that.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Kitten approved
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loves this milk she wears if it's not in her bowl
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie D'Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Kittens liked it
customer_reviews.text: Kittens liked it. Helped mama cat out. Gave some with kittens
customer_reviews.author: D Anderson

customer_reviews.title: My go to kitten formula!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to kitten formula! I foster many kittens and this stuff is the best! Instructions are easy to use and guide you when mixing together the formula and water. No foul odor. Great price! This usually goes for $20 at the local pet stores.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It's what every vet uses so of course you should too.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boost to bottle fed kittens
customer_reviews.text: Gave my kittens born to a deaf feral mother they extra boost they needed after bottle feeding them. This product helps wean them off the bottle and continues to provide the nutrition they need.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly McKown-Strait

customer_reviews.title: It gave kittens diarrhea.
customer_reviews.text: It gave the kittens awful stinky diarrhea! I stopped giving it and they stopped having it. I gave it again and they got it again! Terrible! I don't reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Flower

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for weaning kittens!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered to help my kittens wean to solid food and this formula helped! The taste to them is similar to the wet food so after 2-3 days they weaned completely!
customer_reviews.author: Fabiola Baylon

customer_reviews.title: cats likes it
customer_reviews.text: So sad!i bought two,and my little kitten only tried once ,she lost...... now i only can watch this powered to miss her.........(;'༎ຶД༎ຶ`)
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Cats are happy and healthy
customer_reviews.text: Cats are slowing down on the milk so got the weaning food....good transition....prepares them for more solid food.
customer_reviews.author: RUKidding

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: My kitten that was found in a wall of a hoarders home needed this being away from it's momma
customer_reviews.author: Tonia Miller

customer_reviews.title: They definitely loved this stuff though
customer_reviews.text: This mixed with water and wet cat food was the only thing my baby kittens would eat when I was trying to wean them. I did This for two weeks before finally just switching to reg wet food. They definitely loved this stuff though.
customer_reviews.author: John & Linda Bushko

customer_reviews.title: Stress-free weaning
customer_reviews.text: Had never used a product like this before but decided to take every precaution with this litter of Persian kittens. I used KMR the first 4 weeks and required a transition food for several weeks following. The kittens loved 2nd step and they all made a smooth graduation to regular food. Second step eliminates the worry and promotes successful weaning to either kibble or soft food.
customer_reviews.author: mrs. jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Provided good nourishment for my two kittens after their mother died. I'd mix up a jar of formula, store it in the frig and use it for a couple of days. Kittens' eyes were bright, they gained weight and are well on their way to becoming beautiful, healthy cats.
customer_reviews.author: Little old Susie from AL

customer_reviews.title: for kittens or underweight cats.
customer_reviews.text: used this with wet pate style food for an underweight cat.
customer_reviews.author: HRM Mom

customer_reviews.title: Kittens ate with ease
customer_reviews.text: Kittens ate with ease. No complaints from them :) They gained weight and had no problems
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: we foster kittens until they are ready to be adopted. This works great. We mix it with wet food as they get old enough to start eating wet food....
customer_reviews.author: Coastie4

customer_reviews.title: The best kitten formula.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty unsure about the flavor as I wasn’t the one drinking it.. BUT my foster kittens grew like weeds with KMR! Very affordable compared to local pet stores.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great product for kittens that have lost their mother
customer_reviews.text: Great product for kittens that have lost their mother. 2nd step is like baby cereal in consistency and gives the growing kittens everything they need.
customer_reviews.author: Randy J Faul

customer_reviews.title: Thank Goodness For This!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I nursed 4 barn kittens with KMR and I was sooo happy to see they had a 2nd step food because I was having trouble weaning them off the bottle. It took me two orders of this with all of my kittens, but it was definitely worth it. My kittens took a little longer to wean off replacer, but this helped tremendously. Would recommend to anyone after using the KMR milk replacer!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for young orphan kittens.
customer_reviews.text: If you have kittens that lost their mother you need the milk replacer first and then the KMR 2nd Step. Mixed into a gruel it provides valuable vitamins and nutrients for the youngsters to keep them growing and healthy. You can eventually mix small amounts of other food in the gruel. Our two little boys and healthy and well because of this product. It is tops!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Pringle

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for babies
customer_reviews.text: This is the second can I have bought because I rescue kittens. They are immediately drawn to the smell and flavor and helps put fat on them. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: PetAg KMR 2nd Step Kitten Weaning Food 14oz
product_meta.description: A highly digestible complete food for young growing kittens. KMR 2nd Step Kitten Weaning Food is a creamy transitional cereal developed to follow KMR, for easy transition from milk to solid food. It's completely balanced nutrition meets the nutritional requirements for growth established by the Association of American Feed Control Officials (AAFCO). KMR 2nd Step Kitten Weaning Food has superior digestibility and palatability.
feature_bullets: Made to ease the transition from milk to solid foods
